title: About
text: Circular layouts provide unique powerful way visualize large, complex datasets. Originally popular genomics, exceptionally well-suited data relationships groups trends within structured categories need observed simultaneously.

title: About
text: Circular plots enable visualization hundreds data points maintaining readability. using circular coordinate system: Tracks allow layering multiple sets information (e.g., different phenotypes cohorts). Sectors allow grouping variables meaningful categories (e.g., metabolite classes biological pathways). Efficiency: maximize use display space compared traditional linear plots.

title: About
text: EpiViz R package designed streamline creation Circos plots specifically epidemiologists. acts high-level wrapper around powerful circlize ComplexHeatmap packages.

title: About
text: Circos plots EpiViz composed several key elements:  Template: square area containing plot. Plotting Space: circular area divided sectors. Tracks: Rings within plotting space. Sectors: Divisions circle based data categories. Labels: Variable names outermost edge. Legend: explanatory key generated via ComplexHeatmap.

title: 3. Extras
text: EpiViz allows visualize data using different plot types across tracks. particularly powerful want show different aspects data simultaneously. can combine points, lines, bars single plot.
code: circos_plot(   track_number = 3,   track1_data = EpiViz_data1,   track2_data = EpiViz_data2,   track3_data = EpiViz_data3,   track1_type = "points",   track2_type = "lines",   track3_type = "bar",   label_column = "label",   section_column = "class",   estimate_column = "beta",   pvalue_column = "pvalue",   lower_ci = "lower_confidence_interval",   upper_ci = "upper_confidence_interval",   lines_column = "beta",   bar_column = "beta",   circle_size = 25 )

title: 1. Installation
text: EpiViz package can installed directly GitHub.
code: # Install devtools if you haven't already if (!requireNamespace("devtools", quietly = TRUE))     install.packages("devtools")  # Install EpiViz devtools::install_github("mattlee821/EpiViz") library(EpiViz)

title: 1. Installation
text: common issue installation ComplexHeatmap (core dependency) might automatically available via CRAN R version. see error like package ‘ComplexHeatmap’ available, install directly Bioconductor installing EpiViz: installed, can check version :
code: # Install BiocManager if (!requireNamespace("BiocManager", quietly = TRUE))     install.packages("BiocManager")  # Install ComplexHeatmap BiocManager::install("ComplexHeatmap")  # Now install EpiViz devtools::install_github("mattlee821/EpiViz/R_package") packageVersion("EpiViz")

title: 2. Creating plots
text: common use case EpiViz plotting effect estimates (e.g., betas odds ratios) across multiple sectors. Using built-datasets, can create three-track scatter plot confidence intervals compare different cohorts exposures. following required: estimate_column: central value plot. pvalue_column: Used color significant results differently (filled vs. empty points). pvalue_adjustment: threshold significance (default 0.05). lower_ci & upper_ci: Used draw confidence interval segments. equal_axis: Set TRUE want tracks share Y-axis limits.
code: circos_plot(   track_number = 3,   track1_data = EpiViz_data1,   track2_data = EpiViz_data2,   track3_data = EpiViz_data3,   track1_type = "points",   track2_type = "points",   track3_type = "points",   label_column = "label",   section_column = "class",   estimate_column = "beta",   pvalue_column = "pvalue",   lower_ci = "lower_confidence_interval",   upper_ci = "upper_confidence_interval",   circle_size = 25 )

title: 2. Creating plots
text: comparing multiple tracks, can useful force tracks share Y-axis scale. makes visual comparison easier ensuring vertical distance represents magnitude across tracks.
code: circos_plot(   track_number = 3,   track1_data = EpiViz_data1,   track2_data = EpiViz_data2,   track3_data = EpiViz_data3,   track1_type = "points",   track2_type = "points",   track3_type = "points",   label_column = "label",   section_column = "class",   estimate_column = "beta",   pvalue_column = "pvalue",   lower_ci = "lower_confidence_interval",   upper_ci = "upper_confidence_interval",   equal_axis = TRUE,   circle_size = 25 )

Maximum number tracks 3. track1_data data frame first track. track2_data data frame second track. track3_data data frame third track. track1_type type plot first track. One "scatter", "lines", "bar" "histogram". label_column column data frames use labels circos plot. likely column exposure/outcome name . Labels go outside plot. section_column column data frames use group/section data/plot . order want MR Viz organise columns alphabetically. Default TRUE order_column order = FALSE column want order sections estimate_column column data frames estimates . pvalue_column column data frames p-values . pvalue_adjustment threshold want set p-value 'significance' threshold . can format single value function e.g. 0.05/22. p-value thrshold used scatter plots. lower_ci column data frames lower confidence intervals . upper_ci column data frames upper confidence intervals . lines_column column data frames want plot lines. lines_type type line plot want. "l" = straight lines; "o" = straight lines points; "s" = boxed lines; "h" = vertical lines. Default "o". bar_column column data frames want plot bars. histogram_column column data frames want plot histograms. histogram_binsize binsize histogram. Default 0.01. histogram_densityplot want histogram density plot . Default FALSE. legend_track Track legend control. Default TRUE 0.05. legend centered horizontally items arranged horizontal row. legend_section Section legend control.
